text: Leonidas Flores Reyes (born 24 January 1965) is a retired Costa Rican professional footballer. He played for Puntarenas, Saprissa, Guanacasteca and San Carlos.Leoni corazón - Nación ==Club career== Born in La Palma de Abangares, Guanacaste, Flores started his career at Puntarenas in 1983Regreso a un viejo amor Sorpresivo llamado de Leoni Flores a Selección - Nación and won the 1986 Primera Division de Costa Rica title with them. He was the league's top goalscorer in 1986 with 19 goals.Puntarenas en breve - Nación He had a three-year spell abroad, at Canadian Soccer League side Montreal Supra.Figuras del ayer: Leoni Flores - Nación ==International career== Flores made 30 appearances for the Costa Rica national football team from 1984 to 1996. He also played at the 1984 Olympic Games in two games as sub. Flores scored two goals as Costa Rica won the 1989 CONCACAF Championship, besides having his best performance, was left out from the Italy 1990 World Cup roster.
